headline: Procter & Gamble (PG): Has the Recent Pullback Opened a Quiet Value Opportunity?
summary: Why Procter & Gamble Stock Is Back in Focus Procter & Gamble (PG) has slipped about 6% over the past 3 months and roughly 13% this year, and that pullback is exactly why long term dividend investors are taking a closer look. See our latest analysis for Procter & Gamble. The recent slide comes after a stretch of steady fundamental growth, with Procter & Gamble still posting low single digit revenue and earnings gains even as its year to date share price return sits in negative territory and...
